articles.title: Silicon Valley Bank collapse renews calls to address disparities impacting entrepreneurs of color
articles.description: When customers at Silicon Valley Bank rushed to withdraw billions of dollars last month, venture capitalist Arlan Hamilton stepped in to help some of the founders of color who panicked about losing access to payroll funds.

articles.title: Big-box stores could help slash emissions and save millions by putting solar panels on roofs. Why aren't more of them doing it?
articles.description: As the US attempts to wean itself off its heavy reliance on fossil fuels and shift to cleaner energy sources, many experts are eyeing a promising solution: your neighborhood big-box stores and shopping malls.

articles.title: A record breaking gravitational wave is helping test Einstein’s theory of general relativity
articles.description: A newly detected gravitational wave, GW250114, is giving scientists their clearest look yet at a black hole collision—and a powerful way to test Einstein’s theory of gravity. articles.title: JAY GOLDBERG: Time to open up domestic economy is now
articles.description: It’s time for Canadians to open up our economy — to ourselves. articles.title: Letters, Jan. 31, 2026: ‘Canada lost a true talent’
articles.description: Unique talent I’m deeply saddened by the loss of Catherine O’Hara at age 71. From Home Alone to Schitt’s Creek, her warmth, wit, and unforgettable characters brought joy to audiences around the world. Rest in peace. PAUL BACON, Hallandale Beach, Fla. articles.title: Not only is Lake Powell's water level plummeting because of drought, its total capacity is shrinking, too
articles.description: Lake Powell, the second-largest human-made reservoir in the US, has lost nearly 7% of its potential storage capacity since 1963, when Glen Canyon Dam was built, a new report shows.

articles.description: Speaking alongside Harper in Ottawa, Chrétien said there is a major shift in geopolitics that likely spells the beginning of the end for the American empire.
